titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Myron D. Jeffers Collection circa 1961
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Jodi Allison-Bunnell
titlestmt.sponsor: Funding for encoding this finding aid was provided through a grant awarded by the National Endowment for the Humanities.

publicationstmt.publisher: Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana--Missoula

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Jodi Allison-Bunnell 2004

repository.corpname: University of Montana, Mansfield Library, Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: The collection consists of a short biographical outline of Madison County, Montana, rancher Myron D. Jeffers for his nomination to the “Cowboy Hall of Fame” in Oklahoma City and copies of business and personal letters Myron Jeffers received.

originalsloc.p: At time of donation, originals of letters were in Fay Jeffers' possession.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a short biographical outline of Jeffers prepared by Fay Jeffers, his daughter-in-law, for his nomination to the “Cowboy Hall of Fame” in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, which includes a record of his cattle brand. He was elected to the Hall in 1961 for his contributions to the west and the cattle industry. The collection also includes typescript transcriptions of letters from Mr. Jeffers to his wife and of business letters he received between 1871 and 1893. The letters concern cattle herding and personal matters.

accessrestrict.p: Researchers must use collection in accordance with the policies of Archives and Special Collections, the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, and the University of Montana--Missoula.

userestrict.p: Researchers are responsible for using in accordance with 17 U.S.C. and any other applicable statutes. Copyright not transferred to the University of Montana.

prefercite.p: [Name of document or photograph number], Myron D. Jeffers Collection, Archives and Special Collections, The University of Montana-Missoula.

processinfo.p: The actions of the original processors are unknown; the collection was originally numbered SC 6. In 1998, the collection was re-described and re-numbered Mss 019. In 2004, the finding aid was encoded.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
